Submodules

pywaspgen.modem.modem module

class pywaspgen.modem.modem.MODEM(sig_type)[source]

Bases: object

Base modem class.

gen_samples(num_samples)[source]

Generates a random modulated IQ data sample stream.

Parameters:

num_samples (int) – The length, in samples, of the random modulated IQ data sample stream to generate.

Returns:

A numpy array, of size defined by num_samples, of modulated IQ data samples.

Return type:

float complex

get_sim_awgn(samples)[source]

Calculates a simulated error rate of the modem when impacted by an Additive White Gaussian Noise (AWGN) channel.

Parameters:

samples (float complex) – The modulated IQ data symbols to calculate the error rate from.

Returns:

The simulated error rate in an AWGN channel of the modem calculated from samples.

Return type:

float

get_theory_awgn(snr_db)[source]

Calculates the theoretical error rate of the modem when impacted by an Additive White Gaussian Noise (AWGN) channel.

Parameters:

snr_db (float) – The signal-to-noise ratio (SNR), in dB, to get the error rate for.

Returns:

The theoretical error rate in an AWGN channel of the modem for an SNR, in dB, specified by snr_db.

Return type:

float
